neighbors.name: Commonwealth Of Mass
neighbors.claims: See ORG table

neighbors.name: Town Of Somerset
neighbors.claims: See ORG table

neighbors.name: Richard Warhall
neighbors.claims: Richard Warhall owns a home in the residential neighborhood across the cove from Brayton Point, an area historically impacted by the coal power plant’s operations ([commonwealthbeacon.org](https://commonwealthbeacon.org/uncategorized/decision-judgment-in-brayton-pt-case/#:~:text=Where%20the%20town%20of%20Somerset,to%20operate%20a%20scrap%20metal)). He and his fellow neighbors endured decades of coal dust pollution until the plant’s 2017 closure ([commonwealthbeacon.org](https://commonwealthbeacon.org/uncategorized/decision-judgment-in-brayton-pt-case/#:~:text=Where%20the%20town%20of%20Somerset,to%20operate%20a%20scrap%20metal)). Local residents later described the scrap-metal yard that followed as an “absolute nightmare” of constant dust and noise, reflecting widespread community frustration ([ecori.org](https://ecori.org/2021-8-14-brayton-point-neighbors-fume-over-metals-recycling-operation/#:~:text=said%2C%20that%20is%20driving%20most,neighbors%20crazy)).

approach_recommendations.engage: Hold a personal outreach meeting to explain noise/dust controls and reassure him that his property’s peace and value will be protected.

neighbors.name: Norman Walker Connell
neighbors.claims: Norman W. Connell owned a waterfront Somerset property in the Brayton Point area, with public records showing an address on Ripley Street from about 2009 through 2017 ([nationalpublicdata.com](https://nationalpublicdata.com/people/c/norman-connell/#:~:text=Ripley%20St%2C%20Somerset%2C%20MA%2C%2002726,2009%20%E2%80%93%202017)). He subsequently relocated out of state – records list a Maryland residence for him by 2018 ([nationalpublicdata.com](https://nationalpublicdata.com/people/c/norman-connell/#:~:text=Norman%20Connell%2C%20born%20on%20October,as%20this%20person%27s%20family%20members)) ([nationalpublicdata.com](https://nationalpublicdata.com/people/c/norman-connell/#:~:text=Ripley%20St%2C%20Somerset%2C%20MA%2C%2002726,2009%20%E2%80%93%202017)). No meeting minutes or legal filings reviewed in the Brayton Point case named Connell, indicating he has not played a visible role in local development debates ([commonwealthbeacon.org](https://commonwealthbeacon.org/uncategorized/decision-judgment-in-brayton-pt-case/#:~:text=In%202020%2C%20the%20individual%20defendants,their%20yards%2C%20and%20their%20health)).

approach_recommendations.engage: Reach out via formal letter or phone, emphasizing how the project will be managed to safeguard his property’s value and maintain a quiet environment in his absence.

neighbors.name: Philicia R. Pacheco
neighbors.claims: Philicia R. Pacheco is a Somerset resident and a real estate professional affiliated with JT Realty Group LLC ([vow.mlspin.com](https://vow.mlspin.com/default.aspx?PageId=427364&PageType=6&id=75600#:~:text=Your%20Home%27s%20Value%20%20,)). Her name does not appear in available town minutes or public hearings regarding Brayton Point, suggesting she has not made any official statements on the development ([commonwealthbeacon.org](https://commonwealthbeacon.org/uncategorized/decision-judgment-in-brayton-pt-case/#:~:text=match%20at%20L181%20were%20marked,Dennis%20Champagne%2C%20Ann%20Seery%2C%20Edward)). As a local realtor, she is likely attentive to community changes affecting home values, though her personal position on new projects remains unpublicized ([vow.mlspin.com](https://vow.mlspin.com/default.aspx?PageId=427364&PageType=6&id=75600#:~:text=Your%20Home%27s%20Value%20%20,)).

approach_recommendations.engage: Discuss the project’s potential economic benefits and stable property values in a one-on-one meeting, framing the development in terms of positive impacts on the local housing market and tax base.

neighbors.name: Cheryl Lynne Corey
neighbors.claims: Cheryl Lynne Corey is listed as an owner of property in Somerset, Massachusetts ([www.townofsomerset.org](https://www.townofsomerset.org/AgendaCenter/Planning-Board-3#:~:text=Agenda%20Center)) ([www.townofsomerset.org](https://www.townofsomerset.org/AgendaCenter/Planning-Board-3#:~:text=Agenda%20%20,%7C)). No public meeting records or local news reports mention her involvement in civic issues or development debates ([townofsomerset.org](https://townofsomerset.org/directory.aspx?did=12#:~:text=Staff%20Directory%20%E2%80%A2%20Emergency%20Management,Website%20Sign%20In)) ([www.legacy.com](https://www.legacy.com/us/obituaries/unionleader/name/cheryl-corey-obituary?id=20607882#:~:text=Cheryl%20Corey%20Obituary%20%282013%29%20,Ames%20Corey%20was%20born%20on)). She has not made any documented statements about land use or clean energy projects in the community as of the latest records ([townofsomerset.org](https://townofsomerset.org/directory.aspx?did=12#:~:text=Staff%20Directory%20%E2%80%A2%20Emergency%20Management,Website%20Sign%20In)).
neighbors.influence_justification: No public profile or civic roles

approach_recommendations.engage: Approach one-on-one with basic project information and listen to any concerns. Since she has no known stance, a courteous, informative outreach can help identify any priorities she may have.

neighbors.name: Emmanuel J. Berube
neighbors.claims: Emmanuel J. Berube owns a parcel in Somerset near the proposed development site ([www.townofsomerset.org](https://www.townofsomerset.org/AgendaCenter/Planning-Board-3#:~:text=match%20at%20L48%201320%20Wilbur,Download%C2%A0%E2%96%BC)). There is no record of him holding any town position or speaking at public hearings on development issues ([law.justia.com](https://law.justia.com/cases/massachusetts/court-of-appeals/volumes/34/34massappct339.html#:~:text=interveners,April)) . He has not taken any visible public stance for or against local development or clean energy projects in the community ([law.justia.com](https://law.justia.com/cases/massachusetts/court-of-appeals/volumes/34/34massappct339.html#:~:text=interveners,April)).

approach_recommendations.engage: Engage through an introductory meeting focusing on how the project addresses general community interests. With no stated positions on record, ensure he feels heard and informed while discussing any questions he might raise.

neighbors.name: David R. Berube (Trustee)
neighbors.claims: David R. Berube is listed as a trustee for a property-holding trust in Somerset ([services1.arcgis.com](https://services1.arcgis.com/hGdibHYSPO59RG1h/ArcGIS/rest/services/L3_TAXPAR_POLY_ASSESS_gdb/FeatureServer/0#:~:text=,80%2C%20nullable%3A%20true%2C%20editable%3A%20true)). The trust ownership suggests family control of the land, but no public details of the trust’s purpose or David Berube’s personal activities are documented in town records ([law.justia.com](https://law.justia.com/cases/massachusetts/court-of-appeals/volumes/34/34massappct339.html#:~:text=interveners,April)). He has not been identified in any public forums or news articles as advocating a position on development or energy projects ([law.justia.com](https://law.justia.com/cases/massachusetts/court-of-appeals/volumes/34/34massappct339.html#:~:text=interveners,April)).

approach_recommendations.engage: Coordinate outreach through the trust’s representative (David Berube) in a professional manner. Emphasize transparency about project impacts on property and ensure any long-term land stewardship concerns are addressed to build trust.

neighbors.name: Robert P. Bain Jr.
neighbors.claims: Robert P. “Bobby” Bain Jr. is a Somerset property owner identified as the son of the late Robert Bain Sr. ([www.legacy.com](https://www.legacy.com/us/obituaries/legacyremembers/robert-bain-sr-obituary?id=56031215#:~:text=He%20leaves%20behind%20his%20loving,Carol%20J%20Bain%3B%20and%20siblings)). He does not hold any elected or appointed town office, and no references to his participation in local boards or meetings were found ([townofsomerset.org](https://townofsomerset.org/314/Elected-Officials#:~:text=Selectmen)) ([townofsomerset.org](https://townofsomerset.org/314/Elected-Officials#:~:text=No%20,silva)). There are no public statements by Robert Bain Jr. regarding development projects or energy initiatives in Somerset in the available records ([localheadlinenews.com](https://localheadlinenews.com/wakefield-daily-item-obituary-robert-h-bain-jr-76/#:~:text=Robert%20H,Bob%20was%20born%20on)) .

approach_recommendations.engage: Leverage community connections (if any, through mutual acquaintances) to introduce the project. Given his low public profile, a respectful personal outreach highlighting local benefits and addressing any general concerns (traffic, property values) can help gain his trust.

neighbors.name: Joyce Silva
neighbors.claims: Joyce Silva was the listed owner of a Somerset parcel and is reported to have passed away in 2013 at age 71 ([www.currentobituary.com](https://www.currentobituary.com/member/obit/124322#:~:text=Joyce%20Silva%2C%2071%20of%20Somerset,Stephanie%2C%20Jennifer%2C%20Emily%2C%20Melanie%2C%20Jessica)). An obituary indicates she was a long-time resident who worked as a school bus driver and was survived by her husband and children ([www.currentobituary.com](https://www.currentobituary.com/member/obit/124322#:~:text=Joyce%20Silva%2C%2071%20of%20Somerset,Lee%20Robinson%20of%20Florida)). The property remains in her name as of recent records, with no public documentation of an estate transfer or family member’s stance on development issues ([www.currentobituary.com](https://www.currentobituary.com/member/obit/124322#:~:text=Joyce%20Silva%2C%2071%20of%20Somerset,Stephanie%2C%20Jennifer%2C%20Emily%2C%20Melanie%2C%20Jessica)).

approach_recommendations.engage: Identify the current decision-maker for her property (e.g., surviving spouse or executor) and approach them with sensitivity. Emphasize respect for the family’s situation and clearly explain project details, addressing any concerns about maintaining the character and value of the property.

neighbors.name: Alderic Pettine
neighbors.claims: Alderic Pettine owns a parcel in Somerset but has no evident public roles or business presence in town ([www.townofsomerset.org](https://www.townofsomerset.org/Directory.aspx?did=7#:~:text=Staff%20Directory%20%E2%80%A2%20Council%20on,In)). No meeting minutes or local news references mentioning Pettine could be found, indicating he keeps a low profile ([www.legacy.com](https://www.legacy.com/us/obituaries/heraldnews/name/maryellen-pettine-obituary?id=16673022#:~:text=No%20,alderic)).

approach_recommendations.engage: Use a personal, low-key approach. Since he has no public stance, a one-on-one conversation through a mutual acquaintance or neighbor may help uncover any concerns.

neighbors.name: Troy Paiva Miller (Successor Trustee)
neighbors.claims: This property is held in a trust, with "Troy Paiva Miller" listed as the successor trustee (indicating ownership via an estate or family trust) ([www.townofsomerset.org](https://www.townofsomerset.org/Directory.aspx?did=7#:~:text=Staff%20Directory%20%E2%80%A2%20Council%20on,In)). There is no public information or community involvement identified for this trustee or trust beyond the land records ([www.townofsomerset.org](https://www.townofsomerset.org/Directory.aspx?did=7#:~:text=Staff%20Directory%20%E2%80%A2%20Council%20on,In)).

approach_recommendations.engage: Engage via formal channels. Since the parcel is managed through a trust, contact the trustee directly with clear information on the project’s impacts and assurances addressing any property concerns.

neighbors.name: Jeremiah Silva
neighbors.claims: Jeremiah Silva is an older Somerset resident who moved from Fall River to Somerset later in life ([www.currentobituary.com](https://www.currentobituary.com/member/obit/124322#:~:text=2013,Courtney%2C%20%26%20Hannah%3B%20several%20great)). He and his late wife retired in Somerset, and no records show him taking any active role in local boards or public debates ([www.currentobituary.com](https://www.currentobituary.com/member/obit/124322#:~:text=2013,Courtney%2C%20%26%20Hannah%3B%20several%20great)) ([www.townofsomerset.org](https://www.townofsomerset.org/Directory.aspx?did=7#:~:text=Staff%20Directory%20%E2%80%A2%20Council%20on,In)).

approach_recommendations.engage: Reach out respectfully on a personal level. Given his senior status and low profile, a friendly, in-person visit (possibly involving a neighbor he trusts) can help to listen to any quiet concerns he might have.

neighbors.name: Victoria M. Belmore, Edward J. Belmore Jr., and Paige Belmore
neighbors.claims: The Belmore parcel is co-owned by three family members (Edward J. Belmore Jr., his wife Victoria M., and Paige Belmore), reflecting a family stake in the property ([www.townofsomerset.org](https://www.townofsomerset.org/Directory.aspx?did=7#:~:text=Staff%20Directory%20%E2%80%A2%20Council%20on,In)). There are no mentions of the Belmores in town committee lists or local news, suggesting they have not been publicly involved in civic affairs ([www.townofsomerset.org](https://www.townofsomerset.org/Directory.aspx?did=7#:~:text=Staff%20Directory%20%E2%80%A2%20Council%20on,In)).

approach_recommendations.engage: Use a community-oriented approach. Inviting the Belmore family to a neighborhood meeting or open house about the project could encourage them to voice questions or concerns in a comfortable, family-friendly setting.

neighbors.name: John Silvia
neighbors.claims: John Silvia is a former attorney and Somerset resident. Aside from his former profession, there is no record of him engaging in any town boards or community initiatives in recent years.

approach_recommendations.engage: Provide detailed, factual outreach. Given his legal background, approaching Silvia with thorough documentation and clear answers (especially regarding regulations and property rights) may build credibility and address any concerns he raises.

neighbors.name: Jeremy Souza
neighbors.claims: Jeremy Souza is a Somerset resident and a heavy civil construction superintendent with J.R. Vinagro Corp., based out of Somerset ([wiza.co](https://wiza.co/d/j-r-vinagro-corporation/e00f/jeremy-souza#:~:text=Jeremy%20Souza%20is%20based%20out,Superintendent%2Foperations%20manager%20heavy%20civil%20division)). He has resided in Somerset since at least 2003, according to public address records ([www.menstoppingviolence.org](https://www.menstoppingviolence.org/people/jeremy-souza/#:~:text=39%20Perkins%20St%2C%20Somerset%2C%20MA%2C,02725%202015%20%E2%80%93%202018)).

approach_recommendations.engage: Engage via a peer-to-peer technical discussion. Emphasize project construction plans and mitigations, appealing to his industry background and addressing any heavy-equipment concerns.

neighbors.name: Ralph Stowell Buckley
neighbors.claims: Ralph S. Buckley is a cardiologist (Brown University alumnus) originally from Virginia ([doctor.webmd.com](https://doctor.webmd.com/doctor/ralph-buckley-c6b0704f-a89e-4c22-b566-3c6312428482-overview#:~:text=Hometown%3A%20Falls%20Church%2C%20VA%20University%3A,Fellowship%3A%20Cardiology%20Fellowship%3A%20University%20of)), currently listed as a physician in Mobile, Alabama (age 60) ([connect.medicalnewstoday.com](https://connect.medicalnewstoday.com/provider/dr-ralph-buckley-1043266281#:~:text=match%20at%20L20%20Cardiology,60)). He owns land in Somerset but is an absentee owner with no evidence of local civic involvement ([townofsomerset.org](https://townofsomerset.org/314/Elected-Officials#:~:text=Elected%20Officials%20,Somerset%20Housing)).

approach_recommendations.engage: Use formal written communication to reach out, given his remote residence. Highlight the project’s low environmental and health impact to preempt any concerns he might have as a medically-informed landowner.

neighbors.name: Bruce J. Fletcher
neighbors.claims: Bruce J. Fletcher is listed as a Somerset property owner, though no public background information or community roles could be found for him ([townofsomerset.org](https://townofsomerset.org/314/Elected-Officials#:~:text=Elected%20Officials%20,Somerset%20Housing)). His name does not appear in local news or town committee records, suggesting a very low public profile in the community ([townofsomerset.org](https://townofsomerset.org/314/Elected-Officials#:~:text=Elected%20Officials%20,Somerset%20Housing)).

approach_recommendations.engage: Since little is known publicly, a respectful personal outreach is recommended. Provide project details and invite him to share any concerns directly, signaling openness and transparency.

neighbors.name: Noel L. Cabral
neighbors.claims: Noel L. Cabral is identified as a Somerset landowner with no readily available information on his profession or public activities ([townofsomerset.org](https://townofsomerset.org/314/Elected-Officials#:~:text=Elected%20Officials%20,Somerset%20Housing)). He has not been mentioned in accessible town records or local media, indicating no noted civic or outspoken role regarding community developments ([townofsomerset.org](https://townofsomerset.org/314/Elected-Officials#:~:text=Elected%20Officials%20,Somerset%20Housing)).

approach_recommendations.engage: Approach through a neighborly conversation or letter. Emphasize listening to any personal concerns he may have about the project, given the lack of public information about his priorities.

neighbors.name: Ronald Oliveira
neighbors.claims: Ronald M. Oliveira is a real-estate investor and licensed broker (Massachusetts since 1996) with holdings in the region ([licensefiles.com](https://licensefiles.com/licenses/ronald-m-oliveira/0A0813#:~:text=RONALD%20M%20OLIVEIRA%20Broker%20in,of%20Nov%2025%2C%202016%20at)). He acts as trustee of the Roso Investment Realty Trust and has been involved in multiple property renovation projects, one of which led to a 2016 state consent judgment for improper asbestos removal ([www.mass.gov](https://www.mass.gov/news/new-bedford-landlord-to-pay-100000-to-settle-claims-of-illegal-asbsetos-work#:~:text=The%20consent%20judgment%2C%20entered%20today,the%20harmful%20effects%20of%20asbestos)) ([www.mass.gov](https://www.mass.gov/news/new-bedford-landlord-to-pay-100000-to-settle-claims-of-illegal-asbsetos-work#:~:text=workers%20to%20the%20harmful%20effects,of%20asbestos)).

approach_recommendations.engage: Engage via a business-like meeting highlighting how the development could enhance local property values and economic prospects. Emphasize transparency and regulatory compliance to build trust with him as an experienced property owner.

neighbors.name: Henry M. Maccarone
neighbors.claims: Henry M. Maccarone is a Somerset resident and construction contractor credited with work on 29 permitted projects locally ([www.buildzoom.com](https://www.buildzoom.com/contractor/henry-m-maccarone#:~:text=match%20at%20L973%20,worked%20on%2029%20permitted%20projects)). He was not among the 12 neighbors who appealed the Brayton Point facility’s permit in 2024 ([www.wind-watch.org](https://www.wind-watch.org/news/2024/03/01/brayton-point-offshore-wind-plant-hits-snag-residents-challenge-state-air-quality-permit/#:~:text=The%20Somerset%20Neighbors%20Group%20consists,Kathleen%20Souza)).
neighbors.influence_justification: Local contractor; not a public official

approach_recommendations.engage: Have the project’s construction manager approach Maccarone one-on-one, highlighting opportunities for local contractors and addressing any construction-related concerns.

neighbors.name: George Cotrone
neighbors.claims: George Cotrone appears in Somerset’s property records as a landowner ([cipinl.org](https://cipinl.org/Fij/town-of-somerset-ma-property-records#:~:text=http%3A%2F%2Fwww,land%2C%20marriage%2C%20police%2C%20property%2C%20sex)), but no civic positions or public statements on development are documented for him. He did not participate in the organized neighbor opposition to the Brayton Point project ([www.wind-watch.org](https://www.wind-watch.org/news/2024/03/01/brayton-point-offshore-wind-plant-hits-snag-residents-challenge-state-air-quality-permit/#:~:text=The%20Somerset%20Neighbors%20Group%20consists,Kathleen%20Souza)).

approach_recommendations.engage: Reach out in a small, informal setting (e.g., a neighborly visit) to reassure Cotrone that project noise and visual impacts will be minimal, addressing any concerns about maintaining the area’s peace.

neighbors.name: Antonio E. Sousa, Trustee
neighbors.claims: The parcel is held in a trust with Antonio E. Sousa acting as trustee ([cipinl.org](https://cipinl.org/Fij/town-of-somerset-ma-property-records#:~:text=http%3A%2F%2Fwww,land%2C%20marriage%2C%20police%2C%20property%2C%20sex)). Sousa has no recorded public role in town affairs and was not part of the Brayton Point neighbors’ group opposing the development ([www.wind-watch.org](https://www.wind-watch.org/news/2024/03/01/brayton-point-offshore-wind-plant-hits-snag-residents-challenge-state-air-quality-permit/#:~:text=The%20Somerset%20Neighbors%20Group%20consists,Kathleen%20Souza)).
neighbors.influence_justification: Trustee of family property; not publicly active

approach_recommendations.engage: Coordinate through the family or estate representatives, emphasizing respect for the family’s long-term property interests and assuring that the project will not compromise their legacy or land value.

neighbors.name: Maxwell Millar
neighbors.claims: Maxwell Millar lives in a single-family home in Somerset’s Brayton Point Beach area ([www.fastbackgroundcheck.com](https://www.fastbackgroundcheck.com/address/40-perkins-st/somerset-ma-02725#:~:text=What%20is%20the%20property%20classification,for%2040%20Perkins%20St)). Several Millar family members share this address, indicating a long-standing family presence at the property ([www.fastbackgroundcheck.com](https://www.fastbackgroundcheck.com/address/40-perkins-st/somerset-ma-02725#:~:text=estimated%20to%20have%20%24213%2C325%20worth,below%20for%20a%20%208)).
neighbors.influence_justification: Longtime family residence; no leadership roles

approach_recommendations.engage: Engage the Millar family through a community member they trust, highlighting how the project will preserve neighborhood tranquility and respect the family’s longstanding ties to the area.

neighbors.name: Paul A. Raposa
neighbors.claims: Paul A. Raposa, about 72 years old, is a long-time Somerset resident ([www.yellowbook.com](https://www.yellowbook.com/people/paul-raposa/#:~:text=Paul%20A%20Raposa)). He has not publicly taken a position on the clean energy development and was not among the Somerset neighbors who formally challenged the project ([www.wind-watch.org](https://www.wind-watch.org/news/2024/03/01/brayton-point-offshore-wind-plant-hits-snag-residents-challenge-state-air-quality-permit/#:~:text=The%20Somerset%20Neighbors%20Group%20consists,Kathleen%20Souza)).

approach_recommendations.engage: Have a well-respected local official or neighbor speak with Raposa to address any concerns, reassuring him that the project will be quiet, safe, and considerate of the neighborhood’s character.

neighbors.name: Peter Pelletier
neighbors.claims: Peter Pelletier (age 63) has lived in Somerset since at least the early 1990s, residing at 13 Stoddard Street ([www.menstoppingviolence.org](https://www.menstoppingviolence.org/people/peter-pelletier/#:~:text=%28781%29%20686,are%20related%20to%20this%20person)). No public records of him holding town office or taking positions on development issues were found ([www.townofsomerset.org](https://www.townofsomerset.org/AgendaCenter/Planning-Board-3#:~:text=Enter%20Search%20Terms)).

approach_recommendations.engage: Engage him in a personal conversation emphasizing respect for his property and maintaining the quiet character of the neighborhood, since he has no known public stance or affiliations.

neighbors.name: John Cleary
neighbors.claims: John Cleary is listed as a property owner in Somerset, but he maintains a low profile with no evident public information beyond ownership records ([townofsomerset.org](https://townofsomerset.org/314/Elected-Officials#:~:text=Elected%20Officials%20,Kimberly)). No meeting minutes, news articles, or civic roles naming John Cleary were located in available public sources ([www.townofsomerset.org](https://www.townofsomerset.org/AgendaCenter/Planning-Board-3#:~:text=Enter%20Search%20Terms)).

approach_recommendations.engage: Approach Mr. Cleary one-on-one to listen to any concerns. Since he isn’t publicly active, a respectful direct outreach explaining the project’s benefits and safeguards could help earn his trust.

neighbors.name: James R. Watts
neighbors.claims: James R. Watts, 81, is a longtime Somerset resident (ZIP 02725) and owner of a small masonry contracting business at 21 Swan Street ([www.yellowbook.com](https://www.yellowbook.com/people/james-watts/massachusetts/#:~:text=James%20R%20Watts)) ([www.manta.com](https://www.manta.com/c/mttymc4/james-r-watts-mason-cont#:~:text=About)). He has no record of holding any town office or making public statements about local development ([townofsomerset.org](https://townofsomerset.org/314/Elected-Officials#:~:text=Elected%20Officials%20,Kimberly)).

approach_recommendations.engage: Have a peer from the local business community or a town representative reach out to Mr. Watts. Emphasize how the project could create local jobs and ensure minimal disruption to the neighborhood, aligning with his interests as a retired tradesman.

neighbors.name: Brayton Point LLC
neighbors.claims: Brayton Point LLC is a subsidiary of St. Louis-based Commercial Development Company (CDC) that acquired the 307-acre former Brayton Point Power Station property in late 2017 [CommonWealth Beacon — news, retrieved 2025-12-02; "subsidiary of Commercial Development Inc. of St. Louis"](https://commonwealthbeacon.org/the-download/lobbying-firm-brayton-point-near-settlement-2/)[WBSM — news, retrieved 2025-12-02; "being purchased by Commercial Development Company, Inc., out of St. Louis"](https://wbsm.com/brayton-point-buyer-revealed-investments-planned/). After offshore wind project delays, the company leased portions of the site to scrap metal and road salt operations that neighbors complained were dirty [CommonWealth Beacon — news, retrieved 2025-12-02; "neighbors complained were dirty"](https://commonwealthbeacon.org/the-download/lobbying-firm-brayton-point-near-settlement-2/). Brayton Point LLC defied a cease-and-desist order on those activities until a Land Court order in 2022 forced a shutdown, resulting in fines that amounted to $3,468,400 [Fall River Reporter — news, retrieved 2025-12-02; "fines that amounted to $3,468,400.00"](https://fallriverreporter.com/brayton-point-llc-arraigned-in-fall-river-district-court-for-failure-to-pay-fines/). The company has promoted the site as a renewable energy hub, partnering with transmission firm Anbaric in 2021 and attracting plans for a $200 million Prysmian Group submarine cable factory to support offshore wind projects [Anbaric — company, retrieved 2025-12-02; "transform the site to an offshore wind hub"](https://anbaric.com/project/brayton-point/)[Fall River Reporter — news, retrieved 2025-12-02; "poised to be the site of a manufacturing facility owned by the Prysmian Group"](https://fallriverreporter.com/brayton-point-llc-arraigned-in-fall-river-district-court-for-failure-to-pay-fines/).
neighbors.influence_justification: Controls 300+ waterfront acres; engaged in high-profile legal battles and lobbying; pivotal for planned offshore wind development

approach_recommendations.engage: Engage Commercial Development Co.’s leadership with a joint venture or acquisition proposal aligned with their offshore wind redevelopment vision; emphasize mutual benefits to secure cooperation; prepare for tough negotiations given the company’s litigious history

neighbors.name: New England Power Co
neighbors.claims: New England Power Company (NEP) is an electric transmission utility subsidiary of National Grid that owns high-voltage transmission assets across the region [National Grid — company, retrieved 2025-12-02; "owns the transmission assets that provide wholesale transmission integrated network service across the region"](https://www.nationalgridus.com/Wholesale-Interconnections/New-England/). NEP invested $100 million over five years to construct two new substations and make significant upgrades to transmission lines in Somerset [National Grid — company, retrieved 2025-12-02; "invested $100 million to construct two new substations and make significant upgrades to related existing transmission lines"](https://www.nationalgridus.com/News/2021/04/New-Transmission-Projects-for-Grid-Reliability-are-Operational-in-Southeastern-Mass). Mayflower (SouthCoast) Wind announced plans to bring electricity from its future offshore wind farms ashore at Brayton Point [CommonWealth Beacon — news, retrieved 2025-12-02; "plans to bring ashore at Brayton Point electricity produced by any future offshore wind farms it constructs"](https://commonwealthbeacon.org/the-download/lobbying-firm-brayton-point-near-settlement-2/).
neighbors.influence_justification: Key utility infrastructure owner; essential for power transmission and project interconnection, but minimal direct role in local politics

approach_recommendations.engage: Coordinate early with National Grid’s transmission planning and external affairs teams; ensure project plans accommodate NEP’s rights-of-way and technical requirements; highlight how the development can support grid improvements to secure their cooperation

overview_summary: All three private neighboring landowners have no documented public stance on the Brayton Point redevelopment, though residents in that area have broadly opposed past heavy industrial uses. None hold any public office or formal community leadership, indicating influence remains low among these neighbors. All five neighboring landowners have no documented public stance on development proposals – none were found to have openly supported or opposed projects. They also appear to wield limited influence in the community, as none hold notable public offices or leadership roles based on available records. All five profiled neighbors have an undetermined stance on the proposed development, as none have made public statements supporting or opposing such projects. Likewise, none are high-profile community figures – all appear to have low influence locally, with no current officeholders or prominent leaders among them. All five profiled neighbors have no clearly documented position on the development (5 unknown stances). None are public officials or prominent civic leaders; all appear to wield low community influence, with no high-influence neighbors identified. All five profiled neighbors have no clearly documented stance (support or opposition) toward the development, so their positions remain unknown. None hold high-profile community roles or offices; all appear to be private residents with low individual influence in local affairs. All three profiled neighbors have no recorded stance on local development or clean energy proposals, with each classified as 'unknown' in noted stance. None appear to wield significant community influence – no high-profile roles or major landholdings were identified among these neighbors, and all are rated low in local influence. The adjacent landowners include a major brownfield redeveloper and a utility company. Brayton Point LLC, owned by St. Louis-based Commercial Development Co., controls the former power plant site and has aggressively pursued industrial/offshore wind reuse (while clashing with local officials over interim scrap operations). New England Power Co., a National Grid utility subsidiary, holds transmission infrastructure in the area; it is influential in regional power supply but generally neutral on land development, focusing instead on protecting and utilizing its grid assets for projects like offshore wind.
